<JD_START>
Job Title: Director of Governance, Risk, and Compliance

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Information Technology, Management

Description:
At our client, we're on the lookout for a talented Director of Governance, Risk, and Compliance to join our client's team. If you have a proven track record in building and leading high-performance GRC teams, this role might be perfect for you. As the Director of GRC, you'll play a pivotal role in organizing, planning, and delivering results while collaborating with others to achieve crucial security outcomes. You'll advocate for customer privacy and security rights, embedding these requirements into product offerings, services, and daily business operations. 
Responsibilities:Lead the recruitment, management, motivation, and development of high-performing security/privacy GRC teams.Collaborate with cross-functional leaders within our client's organization to enhance and sustain a resilient GRC program.Provide strategic vision and hands-on leadership in developing and supporting initiatives related to security and privacy policies, standards, training, external audits, continuous control monitoring, customer assurance, and risk assessments.Develop, maintain, and communicate security/privacy assurance and compliance strategies, focusing on expanding the security certification portfolio to align with regulatory and commercial framework requirements in target markets.Conduct regular organizational and asset-level risk and impact assessments to identify security and privacy risks, guiding leaders in prioritizing risk mitigation efforts.Drive operational efficiencies through process and program enhancements and the implementation of automation toolsets.Offer advisory services to other teams, as needed, to ensure compliance with privacy and security policies and standards in their business operations.
Required Skills and Experience:Over 10 years of experience leading all aspects of a Security/Privacy GRC program, with at least 3 years in a SaaS or Tech organization.Proven track record in driving certifications for multiple domestic and international security and privacy frameworks/standards, including ISO 27001, ISO 27701, SOC2, GDPR, IRAP, FedRAMP/StateRAMP, HIPAA, PCI DSS, and CMMC.Demonstrated ability to develop and retain high-performing GRC professionals.Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to translate between business and technical terminology.Excellent cross-functional partnership skills, with the ability to lead multiple stakeholders with conflicting priorities in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Other Skills and Experience:A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or related technical field; or equivalent experience.Certifications such as CRISC, CISA, CISSP, CISM, etc., are considered advantageous.
10xCompanyJobs tracks jobs at a curated list of companies that have the potential to 10x their value.

Experience Level (if available): Director
<JD_END>
